intro: Seseli seravschanicum, commonly known as the Seravshansky seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, often growing at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
